message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.MA, cs.DC 

This paper discusses market-based mechanisms for resource allocation in distributed and multi-agent decision problems, which falls under the category of game theory (cs.GT). The paper also discusses constructing bidding policies, which involves decision-making and optimization, making it relevant to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The use of dynamic programming and approximation methods also suggests that this paper could be relevant to control and optimization (cs.DC) and multi-agent systems (cs.MA).
